elements.title: Ongen
elements.description: helping organisations and small businesses save money on energy costs, reduce carbon footprint and secure energy supply.

elements.title: Origami
elements.description: enterprise technology that enables energy companies to have a single, real-time point of truth across assets, markets and customers

elements.title: Flexible Power
elements.description: Western Power Distribution, SP Energy Networks, Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks and Northern Powergrid have announced they are collaborating on 'Flexible Power' to signpost and operate all of their flexibility requirements. [In the news, Oct 2020](https://theenergyst.com/four-dnos-collaborate-to-streamline-flexibility-across-networks/)

elements.title: Geli
elements.description: Geli, which stands for Growing Energy Labs, Inc., provides software and business solutions for designing, automating, and managing energy storage and microgrid systems.

elements.title: Haven Power
elements.description: Part of the [Drax Group](https://www.drax.com/about-us/) (suppliers of low-carbon energy), Haven Power is a business utility suitable for users over 50,000 kWh of electricity each year.

elements.title: Enian
elements.description: ENIAN is on a mission to fix our broken energy system with data and software. Their platform is an enterprise SaaS solution that provides all of the management tools for renewable energy professionals.

elements.title: Cortex
elements.description: Cortex is built to dramatically improve how buildings operate by applying software and analytics to highly underutilized data streams. By building the software and analytics layer overtop these disparate data streams, we can fundamentally improve the sustainability of commercial buildings, the value of those assets, and the experience of occupants inside them.

elements.title: Station A
elements.description: Instead of providing bits and pieces of data and functionality, we are reimagining how clean energy projects are evaluated and developed from origination to operation.

elements.title: Bee Bryte
elements.description: software-as-a-service minimizing utility bills with automatic control of heating-cooling equipment (e.g. HVAC), pumps, EV charging points and/or batteries

elements.title: Dreev
elements.description: V2G platform. Dreev solution relies on Nuvve technology that has already been deployed and validated on 5 continents. Dreev is a creation of both San Diego based [Nuvve](https://nuvve.com/) and EDF Pulse Expansion.

elements.title: EV energy
elements.description: Our smart platform manages EV charging, automatically optimizing for a greener, cheaper charge.

elements.title: StorageVET and DER-VET
elements.description: The Electric Power Research Institute [EPRI](https://www.epri.com/about) conducts research, development, and demonstration projects for the benefit of the public in the United States and internationally. StorageVET 2.1 facilitates the understanding of where to place and install energy storage, the optimum size as well as controls options. [DER-VET™](https://www.der-vet.com/) is a publicly available, open-source, optimization-based energy valuation and planning tool for distributed energy resources (DER) and larger, centralized energy resources

elements.title: Device Pilot
elements.description: Service monitoring for connected devices: the process of collecting streams of data from individual devices, turning them into metrics, and from those deriving Key Performance Indicators for your device estate as a whole

elements.title: Tesla's Autobidder
elements.description: Autobidder is a real-time trading and control platform that provides value-based asset management and portfolio optimization, enabling owners and operators to configure operational strategies that maximize revenue according to their business objectives and risk preferences.

elements.title: Kaluza
elements.description: Kaluza is OVO Group’s technology platform ecosystem that is driving the transition to a zero carbon grid. Its software platforms enable energy suppliers to empower their customers with unique digital experiences and smart, low carbon technologies

elements.title: Greencom Networks
elements.description: Greencom Networks based in Munich and Sophia Antipolis develops an Energy Information Brokerage Platform made of Connect (a data gateway) + a web platform + a set of applications.

elements.title: Verv energy
elements.description: Verv energy is a trading name of [Green running](https://www.greenrunning.com/about-us/) recently raised on £1M+ on Crowdcube, providing electricity data [disaggregation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZnJeA4-42W4) on signals with resolution of 1s. Verv has also a blockchain solution (see dedicated section).

elements.title: EnergyOS
elements.description: EnergyOS is the platform built on top of research done by CSIRO (Australia) for their [grid modelling tools](https://www.csiro.au/en/Research/EF/Areas/Electricity-grids-and-systems/Intelligent-systems)

elements.title: Flexible power / powermatcher
elements.description: Flexible power / powermatcher is the open source platform released by EF-PI (see above standard section, not really a standard though)

elements.title: Advmicrogrid
elements.description: Advmicrogrid Analytics platform for demand side response and asset management with machine learning, advanced microgrid solutions (closed source), big US based

elements.title: Genability
elements.description: Genability Big US based products and platform for assets, micro-grids, etc. management with machine learning

elements.title: auto-grid
elements.description: auto-grid Massive US based company (recently had 20M+ in funding) building platform for assets management, optimisation, machine learning etc. [link youtube](https://youtu.be/MIijeMOPlBY)

elements.title: AMPP
elements.description: AMPP - Analytics and insights for off-grid assets

elements.title: Eloncity
elements.description: (defunct) Eloncity - Mega platform (under development) Singapore based with blockchain and devices

elements.title: Utility API
elements.description: Utility API , Web api platform for energy consumption and bills

elements.title: Reactive technologies
elements.description: Not really sure what they do?  Reactive technologies grid analytics and cloud solutions maybe? Been [funded by Ingenious](http://www.theingeniousgroup.co.uk/news-views/ingenious-backs-smart-energy-future-with-investment-into-reactive-technologies/)

elements.title: Qbots
elements.description: Qbots AI + API don’t think they have anything released open source

elements.title: GridMarket
elements.description: GridMarket app for microgrid monitoring mentioned [in the news](https://microgridknowledge.com/worlds-largest-microgrid-engie-eps/) for their installation in Palau (Micronesia)

elements.title: Gengame
elements.description: Gengame mobile-gaming industry tools and techniques to solve utilities' challenges, have recently (start 2019) been awarded [a grant from BEIS](https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/783338/BEIS_innovative_domestic_demand-side_response-competition_phase_2.pdf)

elements.title: Mosaik
elements.description: Mosaik allows you to reuse and combine existing simulation models and simulators to create large-scale Smart Grid scenarios

elements.title: Enervee
elements.description: Enervee home appliances marketplace with energy consumption score

elements.title: Power paired
elements.description: Power paired is a platform for asset management for Community Energy Groups

elements.title: CO2 Analytics
elements.description: CO2 Analytics integrates with Xero to provide carbon footprint Measurement & Management Platform for Small and Midsize Businesses

elements.title: Openclimatefix
elements.description: Openclimatefix is a non-profit research and development lab, totally focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions as rapidly as possible.

elements.title: NILMTK
elements.description: NILMTK Non-Intrusive Load Monitoring (NILM) is the process of estimating the energy consumed by individual appliances given just a whole-house power meter reading. Initially developed by Jack Kelly, co-founder of Openclimatefix

elements.title: Tibber
elements.description: Tibber discovered that electricity customers found the offerings from traditional electricity utilities boring, expensive and very complex. The platform automates the process of buying electricity from distributors when it's cheaper and organises consumption for efficiency (assumptions based on descriptions found on website)

elements.title: Enyday
elements.description: Enyday , based in Copenhagen (website in Danish only) wants to become a catalyst for the mass deployment of small renewable energy plants such as solar cells and wind turbines. Basically a platform to share sustainable production in community schemas.

elements.title: Greenely
elements.description: Greenely , Swedish only website, app to manage energy consumption

elements.title: OnSSET
elements.description: OnSSET open source software platform for the assessment and deployment of conventional and renewable energy technologies based on spatial data describing population density and distribution, proximity to transmission and road network, nighttime lights. Aiming at ensuring access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all.

elements.title: NETfficient
elements.description: NETfficient ran from January 2015 to December 2018. It has deployed and demonstrated local energy storage technologies and developed smart technologies to exploit the synergies between energy storage, the smart grid and the citizens. Entails both hybrid hardware and software solutions

elements.title: OpenMUC
elements.description: OpenMUC is a software framework based on Java and OSGi that simplifies the development of customized monitoring, logging and control systems.

elements.title: Carbon footprint calculator
elements.description: Carbon footprint calculator Built by Protea, a social network community to reduce your effect on the climate.

elements.title: Tomorrow app
elements.description: Tomorrow app automatically calculates your carbon footprint by connecting to other services and apps in your life, here's the [open source models](https://github.com/tmrowco/tmrowapp-contrib), same group that developed the [Electricity Map](https://www.electricitymap.org/)

elements.title: A spreadsheet
elements.description: A spreadsheet with a list of carbon calculators maintained by Chris from [Cambridgeshire Climate emergency](http://camemergency.org/)

elements.title: A post on Disco CAT
elements.description: A post on Disco CAT with a list of carbon footprint calculators and tracking tools

elements.title: eSmart Systems
elements.description: eSmart Systems - backed by energy impact partners - builds and delivers the next generation software solutions for inspections of powerlines, grid maintenance planning and energy flexibility optimization.

elements.title: Zeigo
elements.description: Zeigo is a technology platform supporting both supply and demand of renewable energy. Winner of BusinessGreen for [Renewable Energy Technology](https://www.businessgreen.com/bg/news/3084522/businessgreen-technology-awards-all-the-winners) of the year 2019

elements.title: Watershed
elements.description: Watershed helps businesses cut carbon emissions, from the a bunch of guys who were in Stripe

elements.title: Microsoft Sustainability Calculator
elements.description: Microsoft Sustainability Calculator a Power BI application for Azure enterprise customers that provides new insight into carbon emissions data associated with their Azure services

elements.title: Positive Energy
elements.description: Singapore based, European founders. Positive Energy's mission is to accelerate the deployment of renewable energy assets globally with a platform that digitizes the asset finance workflow creating greater efficiency in business processes, operations, transparency and security resulting in higher profitability and performance.
